Detailed Description

This class is a floating-point implementation of an angle.

It lies between the values plus and minus MATH_PI. The operations defined for angle include addition, subtraction, multiplication and division by scalars. Angles can be cast as a float, and floats can be casted as angles.

Member Function Documentation

bool Angle::clampBetween ( Angle  min,
Angle  max 
) [inline]

This method clamps this angle to be between the two input angles.

The range is from the minimum angle to the maximum angle in the positive angle direction.

Returns:
True if the value was clamped, otherwise false.

float Angle::decay ( float  src,
float  dst,
float  halfLife,
float  dTime 
) [inline, static]

This method decays a value towards another value.

The amount decayed is dependent on the half-life, which is the amount of time for the source value to move half-way towards the destination value.

Parameters:
src The original value to begin from.
dst The final destination for the source value.
halfLife The time taken for the source to reach half of the remaining distance.
dTime Amount of time passed in seconds.
Returns:
The new value of the source.

bool Angle::isBetween ( Angle  min,
Angle  max 
) const [inline]

This method whether or not this angle to be between the two input angles.

The range is from the minimum angle to the maximum angle in the positive angle direction.

Returns:
True if in the range, otherwise false.

void Angle::lerp ( Angle  a,
Angle  b,
float  alpha 
) [inline]

This method sets the angle to be the weighted blend across the shortest arc of the given angles.

alpha = 0.0 result = a alpha = 0.5 result = (a+b)/2 alpha = 1.0 result = b

Parameters:
a 
b 
alpha 

float Angle::normalise ( float  value  )  [inline, static]

This method returns the normalised value between MATH_PI and minus MATH_PI.

Parameters:

Returns:

float Angle::sameSignAngle ( float  angle,
float  closest 
) [inline, static]

This method returns the closest angle to the given angle that is the same sign as the given angle.

For example, if -175 was compared to 175, the closest angle returned would be -185.

Parameters:
angle The angle to be compared to.
closest The angle we wish to test to get a closest angle to the previous angle.
Returns:
The closest same-signed angle.

float Angle::turnRange ( Angle  from,
Angle  to 
) [inline, static]

This static helper returns the angle to turn in the positive direction to get from one angle to the other.

Parameters:
from The angle to start from.
to The angle to finish at.
Returns:
A float in the range [ 0, 2 * pi ).
